twcore.core.net
Class ReliablePacketHandler

java.lang.Object
  twcore.core.net.ReliablePacketHandler

public class ReliablePacketHandler
extends java.lang.Object

Handles sending and receipt of reliable packets. Reliable packets are packets that require the receiver to return an ACKnowledgement packet. The ACK packet contains an ID specified in the head of the reliable packet that lets the sender know the packet went through okay. If an ACK is not received, the reliable packet must be resent.

Method Detail

sendReliableMessage

public void sendReliableMessage(ByteArray message)
Constructs and encrypts an outgoing message, and assigns it the next available ACK ID.

Parameters:
message - Reliable packet to be handled

handleReliableMessage

public void handleReliableMessage(ByteArray message)
Handles received packets. First sends an ACK in response to the packet with the specified ACK ID, and then checks to see if that same ID corresponds to the next packet it expects to receive. If not, the packet has arrived out of order, and is placed in a queue to be processed after earlier packets have arrived. If on the other hand the ID matches the expected ID, the packet is sent off to be interpreted, as are any other packets that were received out of order before this one.

Parameters:
message - Reliable packet to be handled

handleAckMessage

public void handleAckMessage(ByteArray message)
Handles a received ACK message in response to a packet the bot sent. When the ACK is received, the reliable packet has gone through without a problem, and the sent packet is removed from the potential resend list.

Parameters:
message - ACK message received

resendUnackedPacket

public void resendUnackedPacket()
Resends all packets that have not been ACKnowledged within the amount of time specified in the method's internal final RESEND_DELAY. (default 3000ms)
